intro: Ectrosia subtriflora, commonly known as the three-flowered ectrosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Ectrosia subtriflora is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
